question: You are currently trying to improve your knowledge of a language which is not your first language. You have a friend who speaks this language fluently. You have decided to write to this friend.Write a letter to your friend. In your letter,•	explain why you want to improve your knowledge of this language – •	ask him/her for suggestions on how to learn more quickly •	propose that you meet your friend to talk about it
text: Hope you are doing well and safe. In your last letter, you had mentioned that your brother is back home after her masters. I trust all is well with him and your parents.

I am grateful that you staying in Germany for 5 years and know the language very well. Like we discussed earlier, I plan to apply at the Berlin University for MS and the applicants must have the A1 certification  to be eligible to enrol. With your help, I believe I'll be able to ace this test.

Adding to that, you had mentioned that you have a few resources, audio and video files and applications that can help me improve my knowledge and skills. Please do share them with me over a letter and I'll get started with the preparation right away.

Adding to that, I have cleared up all my commitments and am completely free for the next 3 months. With your projects getting over, I think you'll also be available during the same duration. If it's all right, Can I come over to Chennai and stay with you? This would really help me out in getting this done sooner.
I look forward to your letter.
